hero.headline:
I'm Jaehyun Ahn, a developer
 who understands people and
 creates value through technology.
hero.subheadline: Designing multilingual products that feel intentional, inclusive, and fast.

about.title: About
paragraphs: Hello! I'm Jaehyun Ahn, a developer who creates user-centered digital experiences.
I enjoy bridging the gap between technology and people, solving complex problems with simple and beautiful solutions.
Currently, I'm focused on AI and mobile technologies, developing services that make users' daily lives more convenient.

danggocho.name: 단고초
danggocho.summary: The most certain Japanese learning service.
features: Developed a LeNet-50 handwriting recognition model for Japanese characters.
Implemented a spaced repetition algorithm tuned for bilingual learners.
Built instant vocabulary capture with iOS Shortcuts integration.

detail.subtitle: AI-powered Japanese learning service

overview.purpose: Deliver an optimized study flow for Korean and Japanese learners with on-device AI handwriting recognition.
overview.target: Mobile learners who need fast feedback and repeatable study loops.
overview.value: Low-latency on-device inference, science-backed SRS scheduling, instant word capture support.

responsibilities: Native iOS application development end to end.
Training and optimizing the LeNet-50 handwriting model.
Designing the spaced repetition algorithm and data flows.
Leading UI/UX design and interaction prototyping.
highlights: Adaptive review scheduling that improves long-term retention by 30%.
Shortcut integration enabling hands-free vocabulary capture.

challenge.problem: Early builds consumed too much battery and required ~1.5s per inference.
challenge.solution: Applied Core ML optimizations, batched processing, and tuned asynchronous pipelines.
challenge.result: 87% faster inference (0.2s) with 40% lower battery usage and 4.8/5.0 user satisfaction.

acon.name: Acon
features: Shipped an onboarding flow that customizes recommendations from the first session.
Implemented taste profiling with iterative preference inputs.
Integrated MapKit-powered nearby search with saved spots.

detail.subtitle: Personalized dining discovery

overview.purpose: Analyse user taste to recommend restaurants in real time.
overview.target: Food lovers in their 20s–30s who explore new places weekly.
overview.value: Taste-based personalization with intuitive UI and fast search.

responsibilities: Designed and developed the onboarding funnel.
Implemented core UI flows and interaction states.
Optimized MapKit integration for smooth navigation.
highlights: Reduced onboarding steps from 7 to 3 while keeping context.
Improved completion rate to 85% with progress and skip options.
Enabled shareable recommendations and group planning.

challenge.problem: A complex onboarding caused a 45% drop-off on the first screen.
challenge.solution: Condensed the journey, added progress cues, and introduced a skip path.
challenge.result: Drop-off fell to 18% and onboarding completion reached 85%.

pliad.name: Pliad
features: Built a single FastAPI gateway powering 30+ endpoints.
Prototyped LangGraph agents for autonomous data operations.
Delivered dashboards with near real-time business metrics.

detail.subtitle: AI agent pipeline for e-commerce teams

overview.purpose: Automate data ingestion, cleaning, and insights for B2B commerce clients.
overview.target: SME commerce teams and internal data analysts.
overview.value: Hands-off data processing with AI-generated insights and live dashboards.

responsibilities: Architected the FastAPI backend and deployment pipeline.
Implemented batch + streaming ETL with monitoring.
Designed optimized PostgreSQL schemas and indexing strategies.
highlights: Agent-driven anomaly detection across multi-source feeds.
JWT-secured APIs with WebSocket live updates.
AI-authored insight summaries for weekly reports.

challenge.problem: Processing 100k+ records took over 30 minutes and exhausted memory.
challenge.solution: Introduced streaming pipelines, tuned batch sizes, and layered Redis caching.
challenge.result: Processing time dropped to 1.5 minutes with 60% lower memory usage.
